translation.en: Who are we?
How did we become the way we are?
translation.ko: 우린 어떻게 이런 존재가 된 걸까요?

translation.en: As humans, we spend our lives
trying to understand ourselves.
But sometimes it feels we're too close to see clearly.
translation.ko: 하지만 스스로가 어떤 존재인지 객관화하긴 쉽지 않죠

translation.en: That's why we love stories from other worlds.
translation.ko: 그래서 우리는 다른 세계 얘기를 좋아합니다

translation.en: And the world of chimpanzees,
so similar to ours in some ways…
…but so different in others…
tells us stories more revealing than you can imagine.
translation.ko: 이 세계에 관한 이야기는 여러분의 상상 이상일 겁니다

translation.en: Stories all the more powerful
because they are real.
The Forest of Ngogo is a vast, interconnected world.
translation.ko: 광활한 응고고 숲은 전체가 연결돼 있습니다

translation.en: And at its heart,
there is a thriving society.
The Ngogo chimpanzees.
For this new mother and her baby,
translation.ko: 지금 보이는 이 어미와 새끼 침팬지는

translation.en: it's home.
Chimpanzees are our closest living relatives.
We share more than 98% of our DNA.
They are highly intelligent.
And highly emotional.
They can live to over 60 years old,
and the stages of their lives are similar to ours.
Every chimp at Ngogo is an individual…
with their own unique personality and goals.
translation.ko: 고유의 성격과 목표를 지닌 인격체라고 볼 수 있습니다

translation.en: To reflect this,
scientists have given each and every one of them a name.
translation.ko: 과학자들은 이들에게 일일이 이름을 붙여줬죠 "포크 파이"

translation.en: Ngogo society is sophisticated.
It's a complex network of family and social bonds…
where each chimp has to forge relationships
translation.ko: 각각의 침팬지들이 유대 관계를 공고히 하면서

translation.en: and find their place in the group.
Most chimp groups number 50 or 60 individuals.
But here at Ngogo,
there are twice that number.
Over 120 chimps living together.
translation.ko: 120마리가 넘는 침팬지가 무리를 지어 살고 있죠

translation.en: The biggest group ever discovered.
translation.ko: 지금까지 발견된 무리 중 가장 큽니다

translation.en: Ngogo is a chimpanzee paradise.
There's a huge amount of fruit trees here.
And fruit is the lifeblood of chimpanzee society.
translation.ko: 과일은 침팬지 무리의 생명줄이라 해도 과언이 아니죠

translation.en: With so many chimps all trying to make their way,
translation.ko: 과일을 찾는 침팬지의 수가 많다 보니

translation.en: there's a lot of competition.
Life here involves politics and power.
translation.ko: 이곳에서의 삶은 정치, 권력과 관계가 깊죠

translation.en: Ngogo society is a hierarchy.
And the chimps are always looking for opportunities
to move up.
At the top of the hierarchy sits the most powerful chimp at Ngogo.
translation.ko: 무리의 우두머리는 그중 가장 강력한 녀석이죠

translation.en: Jackson. The alpha male.
Jackson has been in charge for six years now.
But he's getting old for an alpha.
If he's going to stay on top,
he can't show any weakness.
He needs to display strength.
This is what Jackson wants.
The group is calling
and coming to him in a show of respect.
But Jackson is well aware
that some chimps are showing less respect than others.
translation.ko: 다들 이 정도로 자기를 따르진 않는다는 걸요

translation.en: A chimp this age should be too young to pose a real challenge to Jackson.
translation.ko: 이 정도 나이의 침팬지가 잭슨한테 도전하기는 어렵죠

translation.en: But not all chimps are as smart
or as confident as Abrams.
But Jackson has protection.
Miles.
A giant chimp.
The biggest ever known at Ngogo.
Jackson and Miles share a tight bond…
and groom each other regularly.
It's a formidable alliance.
Grooming is an important part of life for all chimpanzees.
It's how they create and maintain social relationships.
It's the chimp equivalent of conversation.
It's highly political.
Planning.
Persuading.
Plotting.
Grooming forms alliances.
And alliances create power.
translation.ko: "5번, 카터 4번, 피터슨, 6번, 모턴" 동맹은 권력을 창출합니다

translation.en: Even the strongest chimps
struggle to dominate alone.
translation.ko: "7번, 에번스 8번, 윌슨" 혼자 힘으로 무리를 통솔할 순 없죠

translation.en: Who your grooming partners are
says a lot about your status and ambitions.
translation.ko: 무리에서의 위치와 각자의 야심을 알 수 있습니다

translation.en: But if you aren't grooming with anyone,
status and ambition are the least of your worries.
translation.ko: 사회적 위치와 야심엔 관심이 없다고 볼 수 있죠

translation.en: Fourteen is not an easy age for a male chimp.
You've grown apart from your mother…
…and you need to start bonding with other males.
That comes more easily to some
than others.
Gus is an outsider.
But he can't stay that way.
translation.ko: 하지만 계속 이대로 있을 순 없죠

translation.en: He needs to find some friends.
In the Forest of Ngogo,
it's not wise to spend too much time alone.
Christine's baby is about six months old.
For this age, she's much stronger and more developed than a human baby.
translation.ko: 같은 나이의 인간 아이보다 훨씬 발달이 빠르죠

translation.en: But she's still very vulnerable.
At Ngogo, not all babies make it to their first birthday.
translation.ko: 응고고에선 한 살이 되기 전에 죽는 침팬지도 많죠

translation.en: And for that reason,
she won't be given her name until then.
translation.ko: 한 살 전에는 이름을 지어주지 않습니다

translation.en: Christine has to focus on the baby,
translation.ko: 크리스틴은 새끼를 키우는 데 온 힘을 쏟아야 해서

translation.en: and that has left her older daughter, Nadine, out in the cold.
translation.ko: 큰딸인 네이딘에게 신경 쓸 여유가 없습니다

translation.en: She used to get her mother's full attention.
Now she's neglected.
Even for a chimp, the baby is developing quickly.
translation.ko: 이 녀석은 새끼 침팬지치고도 발달이 빠른 편입니다

translation.en: And she's starting to become more independent.
translation.ko: 점점 더 독립적인 면모를 보이고 있죠

translation.en: She wants to socialize.
When it comes to babies, most chimps are pretty tolerant.
Still, it's safer to start with someone closer to your own size.
translation.ko: 그래도 비슷한 덩치인 녀석이 좀 더 안전하겠죠

translation.en: The problem is that young chimps are far less forgiving.
translation.ko: 문제는 새끼 침팬지가 그리 관대하지 않다는 겁니다

translation.en: The more independent the baby becomes,
the more she can get into trouble.
Big males are a threat.
If she gets in their way, she could be badly hurt.
And with an alpha like Jackson,
who can choose to display anywhere, anytime…
translation.ko: 언제 어디서든 출몰할 수 있는 상황입니다

translation.en: Christine can never completely relax.
translation.ko: 그러니 크리스틴은 한시도 맘 편하게 쉴 수가 없죠

translation.en: It's all a bit overwhelming.
Her mother has seen all this before.
translation.ko: 이런 일은 전에도 겪은 적이 있죠

translation.en: She isn't concerned.
But her big sister is.
The first signs of a bond between sisters.
translation.ko: 자매 사이에 유대감이 싹트기 시작한다는 신호입니다

translation.en: Ngogo is a rainforest.
Storms are part of life here.
And the chimps generally take cover.
Though not all of them.
Some chimps draw strength from the storm.
And use it to perform an unusual dominance display.
translation.ko: 그리고 이를 이용해 특이한 형태로 힘을 과시하죠

translation.en: The rain dance.
Abrams is sending a powerful message.
For now, Jackson does nothing.
Sooner or later, he'll have to act.
Because with every day,
Abrams is getting more confident.
Gus is still alone.
But he's got a plan.
Gus is awkward, but he isn't stupid.
Jackson isn't the only one
to notice that Abrams is on his way up.
This could be an opportunity to form a very useful relationship.
translation.ko: 잘만 하면 좋은 연줄을 만들 기회입니다

translation.en: Gus is really trying.
An up-and-comer like Abrams is happy to be groomed by most chimps.
translation.ko: 에이브럼스 같은 유망주는 많은 침팬지에게 그루밍 받고 싶어 하죠

translation.en: The real test for Gus
will be if Abrams grooms him back.
Rejection.
Abrams is seeking out a much more important grooming partner.
translation.ko: 에이브럼스는 훨씬 더 강력한 그루밍 파트너를 찾고 있죠

translation.en: If Abrams can build his own alliance with Jackson's most important ally,
translation.ko: 에이브럼스가 잭슨의 최측근과 동맹을 맺을 수 있다면

translation.en: it will weaken Jackson's position as alpha.
translation.ko: 우두머리인 잭슨의 지위를 약화시킬 수 있습니다

translation.en: And Miles seems receptive.
translation.ko: 마일스도 어느 정도 받아들이는 것 같군요

translation.en: Jackson can feel Abrams closing in.
He needs the group to unite under his leadership.
translation.ko: 본인의 지휘하에 무리를 모아야 할 때가 왔죠

translation.en: Unite against a common enemy.
Chimps are territorial creatures.
The Ngogo group lives within a defined territory,
translation.ko: 응고고 숲의 침팬지는 정해진 영역 내에서 생활하고

translation.en: surrounded on all sides by other hostile chimps.
To make sure their resources are safe,
they patrol their borders.
Patrolling is a dangerous business.
But the importance of defending the territory is so great
translation.ko: 하지만 침팬지에게 영역 보호는 매우 중요한 일이라

translation.en: that even the most unlikely candidates sometimes take part.
translation.ko: 뜻밖의 녀석이 순찰대에 합류할 때도 있습니다

translation.en: Each chimp needs to weigh it up.
"Is it worth the risk?"
Pork Pie is far from the toughest or bravest of chimps.
translation.ko: 포크 파이는 용감, 용맹과는 거리가 먼 녀석입니다

translation.en: But even for him, it's probably worth the danger.
translation.ko: 하지만 이런 녀석조차도 순찰의 위험을 감수하죠

translation.en: The chimps are heading to their northern border.
Patrols can cover many miles
and last for several tense hours.
Even the biggest, most aggressive males
begin to get nervous as they approach the borderlands.
As for Pork Pie,
he's at the back
and seems reluctant to go on.
Abrams, on the other hand,
is exactly where he wants to be.
Right in the thick of it.
As the group reaches the northern border
and passes into unfamiliar territory,
things get more dangerous.
There are no friendly relations between chimp groups.
When one group meets another,
there are two choices.
Run or attack.
The chimps are listening for calls
and movement.
Pork Pie has had enough.
He's leaving the patrol.
Alone.
But Gus is going to stay.
There are other chimps close by.
And they will be hostile.
They need to judge who has the greater numbers…
translation.ko: 어느 쪽이 수적으로 우세한지 파악해야 합니다

translation.en: and decide whether to retreat
or to attack.
Jackson has Miles behind him.
There's no going back.
They've decided to charge.
Their aggression has paid off.
The northern group has retreated.
This is a success for the patrol.
The border is secure,
and they can return to the center of their territory, victorious.
With most of the big males away to the north,
translation.ko: 덩치 큰 수컷 대부분이 북쪽 순찰을 나가고 나서야

translation.en: Christine can finally relax.
The baby is getting stronger.
And it's time for her to explore another important part of life at Ngogo.
translation.ko: 이제 응고고에서 빼놓을 수 없는 세계를 알아가야 할 때입니다

translation.en: The canopy.
Not impressed.
Christine can't let her climb too high,
translation.ko: 크리스틴은 너무 높이 올라가지 못하게 합니다

translation.en: to where a fall could be dangerous.
That's enough for one day.
The patrol is returning from the borderlands.
And they've noticed something in the treetops.
translation.ko: 나무 꼭대기에 뭐가 있는 걸 발견했군요

translation.en: The Ngogo group doesn't tolerate other chimps in their territory.
translation.ko: 응고고 무리는 다른 침팬지의 영역 내 침입을 용납 안 합니다

translation.en: But they do share the forest with other primates.
Including several large groups of monkeys.
Monkeys aren't rivals to chimps.
They're food.
Meat is a welcome source of nourishment for chimps.
But that's not its only value.
The sharing of meat is important socially
translation.ko: 고기를 나눠 먹는 건 사회적인 측면이나

translation.en: and politically.
Jackson shares with his allies.
And more than anyone else, he shares with Miles.
At the same time,
he purposely leaves others out.
Abrams' exclusion is a sign that, for now,
Jackson still holds power at Ngogo.
translation.ko: 아직 응고고 침팬지 우두머리가 잭슨이란 뜻이죠

translation.en: A victorious patrol
and a successful hunt.
Today's been a good day for Jackson
and for the Ngogo chimpanzees.
Monkeys are an important resource for the Ngogo chimps.
But the most important resource will always be fruit trees,
translation.ko: 하지만 가장 중요한 먹이는 어디까지나 과일이고

translation.en: the foundation of Ngogo society.
translation.ko: 그게 응고고 침팬지 사회을 기반을 이루고 있죠

translation.en: A fig tree has come into fruit in the center of the territory,
translation.ko: 영역 한가운데에 있는 무화과나무에서 열매가 열렸고

translation.en: and the chimps can relax and enjoy a feast.
Gus has spent a lot of his life watching from the sidelines.
He's more observant than most.
And quick to spot anything unusual.
It's Pork Pie.
He was caught alone…
and killed by a rival group…
right in the middle of Ngogo territory.
If a chimp can be killed here…
…it means this forest kingdom…
…and all the chimps in it…
are no longer safe.
